oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CEO Henry Ford II visit to Ford Motor Company Glass Plant, Nashville, Tennessee, 1961 May 10
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured left to right: Nashville Mayor Ben West presenting an Honorary Citizenship of the City of Nashville to CEO Henry Ford II, May 19th, 1961. Ford, chairman of the board of Ford Motor Company, headed Nashville’s Ford auto glass plant expansion, the Ford Motor Company Glass Plant, a large industrial facility located on Centennial Boulevard. The 1964 City Directory cites L. O. Seltz as the Plant Manager. Business executive Henry Ford II (September 4, 1917 – September 29, 1987), was the oldest son of Edsel Ford and oldest grandson of Henry Ford. He was president of the Ford Motor Company from 1945 to 1960, chairman and CEO from 1960 to 1979, and chairman for several months thereafter. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
